001package io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.util;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.core.Assertion;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.core.AssertionResult;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.core.AssertionType;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.exceptions.InvalidAssertionException;
007import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.registry.AssertionRegistry;
008import java.util.List;
009import java.util.Map;
010
011/**
012 * Utility class for executing and validating assertions against provided data.
013 *
014 * <p>This class processes assertions, validates input data, and applies the appropriate validation
015 * logic. It ensures compatibility between expected and actual values before evaluation.
016 *
017 * <p>Assertions are applied based on registered validation functions, and the results
018 * are returned as {@link AssertionResult} objects.
019 *
020 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
021 */
022public final class AssertionUtil {
023
024   private AssertionUtil() {
025   }
026
027
028   /**
029    * Validates a set of assertions against a given data map.
030    *
031    * @param data       The data map containing key-value pairs to validate against.
032    * @param assertions The list of assertions to be applied.
033    * @param <T>        The type of values being validated.
034    * @return A list of {@link AssertionResult} objects representing validation outcomes.
035    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the data map is null or no assertions are provided.
036    */
037   public static <T> List<AssertionResult<T>> validate(Map<String, T> data, List<Assertion> assertions) {
038      if (data == null) {
039         throw new IllegalArgumentException("The data map cannot be null.");
040      }
041      if (assertions == null || assertions.isEmpty()) {
042         throw new IllegalArgumentException("At least one assertion must be provided.");
043      }
044
045      return assertions.stream().map(assertion -> validateSingle(data, assertion)).toList();
046   }
047
048
049   /**
050    * Validates a single assertion against the data map.
051    *
052    * @param data      The data map containing key-value pairs.
053    * @param assertion The assertion to be validated.
054    * @param <T>       The type of the value being validated.
055    * @return An {@link AssertionResult} indicating whether the assertion passed or failed.
056    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the key does not exist or has a null value.
057    */
058   private static <T> AssertionResult<T> validateSingle(Map<String, T> data, Assertion assertion) {
059      validateAssertion(assertion);
060
061      String key = assertion.getKey();
062      T actualValue = data.get(key);
063
064      if (actualValue == null) {
065         throw new IllegalArgumentException(
066               String.format("Key '%s' in assertion does not exist or has a null value in the data map.", key)
067         );
068      }
069
070      AssertionType<?> type = assertion.getType();
071      validateTypeCompatibility(type, actualValue);
072
073      var validator = AssertionRegistry.getValidator(type);
074      boolean passed = validator.test(actualValue, assertion.getExpected());
075
076      return new AssertionResult<>(
077            passed,
078            type.type().name(),
079            assertion.getExpected(),
080            actualValue,
081            assertion.isSoft()
082      );
083   }
084
085
086   /**
087    * Ensures that the given assertion is valid.
088    *
089    * @param assertion The assertion to validate.
090    * @throws InvalidAssertionException if any required field in the assertion is missing or null.
091    */
092   private static void validateAssertion(Assertion assertion) {
093      if (assertion == null) {
094         throw new InvalidAssertionException("Assertion cannot be null.");
095      }
096
097      if (assertion.getKey() == null || assertion.getKey().isEmpty()) {
098         throw new InvalidAssertionException("Assertion must have a non-empty key.");
099      }
100   }
101
102
103   /**
104    * Validates type compatibility between an assertion type and the actual value.
105    *
106    * @param type        The assertion type.
107    * @param actualValue The actual value to be validated.
108    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the actual value type does not match the expected type.
109    */
110   private static void validateTypeCompatibility(AssertionType<?> type, Object actualValue) {
111      Class<?> supportedType = type.getSupportedType();
112      Class<?> actualValueClass = actualValue.getClass();
113
114      if (!supportedType.isAssignableFrom(actualValueClass)) {
115         throw new IllegalArgumentException(
116               String.format(
117                     "Assertion type '%s' is not compatible with the actual value type '%s'.",
118                     type, actualValueClass.getName()
119               )
120         );
121      }
122   }
123
124}
